intro: Lessertia incana, commonly known as the silver leaf tree, is a deciduous tree native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its silvery-white, hairy leaves that give it a distinctive appearance. The plant belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is known for its ability to thrive in arid and semi-arid environments. It produces small greenish-yellow flowers followed by orange-red fruits that contain seeds. The tree is often used in traditional medicine and has ecological importance in its native habitat.
